{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Creative |model=CW2200 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=01/12/2004 |manuf_country= |manuf=Askey |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=unknown if released |type=wireless router |fcc_id=GX5-CW2200 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac=true |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4702 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num=1 |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Broadcom BCM94306MP |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4306 |wi1_chip2_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip2_model=BCM2050 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Altima |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=11g AP |default_ssid_regex=^11g AP$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''Wireless 54Mbps Access Point'' - '''Powered by Broadxent'''
"3017-001200" is silkscreened on the wireless module in the FCC photos. :The main board is presumed to use BCM4702.
Default settings are per the FCC manual. They are probably completely wrong.
The power supply shown in the FCC photos is a '''OEM'''-branded AA-121A (120VAC ~ 60Hz, 18W -> 12VAC, 1A).
